name: Albino Kitsune
description:
Kitsune (Japanese for Fox) stories depict them as intelligent beings and as possessing magical abilities that increase with their age and wisdom. Foremost among these is the ability to assume human form. While some folktales speak of kitsune employing this ability to trick others—as foxes in folklore often do—other stories portray them as faithful guardians, friends, lovers, and wives. (Wikipedia.org)

The more tails a kitsune has—they may have as many as nine—the older, wiser, and more powerful it is. (Wikipedia.org)

In this miniature painting, an albino, three-tailed kitsune sits, awaiting it's new home.

"Albino Kitsune"
acrylic on birch panel
3 x 2.5 inches, framed to 3.75 x 4.25 inches
2013

*painting is signed/dated/titled by the artist

*acrylic paint on 3 x 2.5 inch birch wood panel

*shiny finish: painting has been varnished for protection against fading

*framed in white mini frame; ready for hanging

*Any questions, please ask!

name: The Vision
description:
Four field mice experience the terrifying vision of a horned owl angrily screeching from the crystal ball. For protection, they wield strawberries and their flowers, symbolizing foresight, or future promise in Floriography, the Victorian language of flowers.

"The Vision"
5 x 7 inches, framed
acrylic on birch panel
2013


*painting is signed/dated/titled by the artist

*acrylic paint on 5 x 7 inch birch wood panel

*shiny finish; painting has been varnished for protection against fading 

*Any questions, please ask!

name: A New Friend
description:
A snow white pit bull meets a new butterfly friend as an owl looks on.  The sweet nature of the scene is highlighted by an ornate, white frame.

* acrylic on birch wood panel

* 4.5 x 6.5 inches oval framed to 8.5 x 12 inches approximately

* wired and ready to hang

* signed/dated/titled by the artist

* varnished/shiny finish to protect from fading/damage

* a portion of the purchase price will go to an animal shelter

Any questions, please ask!

name: I'm Here For Your Heart and I'm Not Leaving Without It
description:
"I'm Here For Your Heart and I'm Not Leaving Without It"
Inspired by agriozoophilia; the obsessive love of wild animals
acrylic on birch panel
12 x 9.5 inches oval framed to 18 x 13 inches
2013


Agriozoophilia; the obsessive love of wild animals, which is definitely something I have!
I was also inspired by Valentine's Day, love, jealously, hatred, confusion; really all the mixed emotions that this holiday can stir up.  

The animals are all experiencing different emotional states within or without relationships, and the title is both literal and figurative.

The painting is varnished to protect from damage and fading, and comes signed/titled, and ready to hang.

Any questions, please contact me!
